Key Match Events: Marquinhos scored from close range off a set piece, but was ruled offside after a lengthy video review.
Lucas Paqueta's left-footed shot from outside the box eluded Sequeira but struck the near post.
Haxzel Quiros misplayed an attempted clearance, sending it at his team's goal instead, but Sequeira reacted quickly and pushed the ball wide of the left post.
Pre-Game Insights: Brazil has struggled of late, winning only two of its last eight games to fall to sixth in CONMEBOL's World Cup qualifying tournament.
Post-Match Reflections: Brazil's unimpressive performance against No. 52 Costa Rica offered little reason to think Brazil will turn around soon.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at SoFi Stadium.
Costa Rica keeper Patrick Sequeira made several crucial saves to keep the score at 0-0.
Others: Brazil dominated in possession, controlling the ball for more than 65 of the 90 minutes while outshooting Costa Rica 19-2.
